intro: Asterocephalus pseudobanaticus, commonly known as the Banat's false aster, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptations to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, yellowish flowers in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
